intro: Stoebe rugulosa, commonly known as rough mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a rough texture, and it produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Stoebe rugulosa is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
